name: Hilton York

reviews.text: this hotel was very central for shops, attractions etc, right across the road from cliffords tower, took us about 10-15 minutes to walk from the train station. we stayed 2 nights bed, breakfast and evening meal and paid a good price.
reviews.title: great location for everything, clean and food was lovely

reviews.text: check in was quick the guy at reception was lovely, we chose our time to book in for evening meal, we were on the second floor, there were 3 lifts which was plenty for the size of the hotel, the room was a good size, clean and tidy, toiletries in the bathroom, tea/coffee and biscuits on tray with kettle, good sized televison. the beds were comfy, radiator a litle noisy the second night, but it would not put me off staying there again.
reviews.title: Central location, comfortable stay

reviews.text: we went to breakfast about 8.30/9 the first morning, we were seated, but it did get busy and people were having to wait, plenty of choice and it was lovely.
reviews.title: Excellent location, breakfast and a comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: evening meal was lovely, plenty of choice, 3 courses, if you prepay there are supplements for a couple of items, but not much and good value.
reviews.title: Great location hotel

reviews.text: drinks did not seem any more expensive than anywhere else in york
reviews.title: Perfectly located, clean, comfortable hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extremely helpful staff, rooms are tastefully decorated and clean. Out 2nd stay here and both have been very positive.
reviews.title: Relaxing Atmosphere

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Hilton York on a number of occasions over the past few months.
reviews.title: Perfect location for business or leisure visit ....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well located for a visit to the city, while being extremely easy to access by road. The main shopping centre is no more than a 5-10 minute walk away, as is the world renowned Minster.
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel rooms are well appointed and come complete with flat screen TV, desk area, hair dryer, ironing board (c/w iron) and tea & coffee making facilities. The bathroom while a little small, was functional and came with the usual toiletries that you find in most Hiltons.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel restaurant is pleasant, with views of Clifford's Tower and the service is always friendly. The dinner menu is varied, if a little expensive for the size of portion. Breakfast is served in the same restraint as dinner, and is very good in terms of value and quality.
reviews.title: convenient for all facilities

reviews.text: We have just returned as a party of 7 who visited York for half term and stayed two nights at the York Hilton. The hotel is in a super location just in front of Clifford's Tower so fantastic for the three boys in our party (ages 10, 7 and 6) . The staff at the hotel were outstanding. The breakfast was great and the waiting staff at breakfast even noticed that we were celebrating the 10 year old's birthday. They prepared some lovely pancakes (with absolutely no request or prompting) and they had added a birthday message and 10 candles. They sang happy birthday with us and the 10 year old was really thrilled. What kind and thoughtful staff. The hotel should be proud! We had two double-double rooms. The rooms are absolutely fine. Nicely decorated and very clean. Not much space but you don't need it for a couple of nights. The only niggle we had was that that room was very hot and we could not turn down the heating. We have stayed here previously and will definately stay again for the location, great staff and great breakfast :-)
reviews.title: Great location, amazing staff, room just a little too hot

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night. As a family with 2 adults and 2 children we had a double/double room. The room had 2 double beds. Room was not very big for 4 people but was all that we needed as hardly spent any time in there. The room was very clean with tea/coffee. Reception staff were very pleasant. The breakfast buffett was very good with lots of choice: hot english breakfast, cold meats, fruit, cereal and pastries. There is only one thing I could say as a negative and that is outside the hotel doors there was a horrible smell of dirty sewers. All in all a nice hotel to stay in very close to the city centre.
reviews.title: nice hotel, close to york centre

reviews.text: The Hilton Hotel York is an excellent choice for location, quality and service. Sited about 300 metres away from Clifford's Tower (the keep of York Castle, with this as the view from the dining room) you immediately feel in the heart of wonderful medieval York. The decor, room furnishing and courtesy of the staff are all first rate and breakfast surpasses the Yorkshire reputation for filling you up for the rest of the day! The quality of the both the traditional English and the continental breakfasts left nothing to be desired. We were more than happy with the quality of both our room and the bathroom.
reviews.title: Excellent quality

reviews.text: Parking was fairly expensive but on site and under cover. York is a compact city and everything is within very easy walking distance of the hotel.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Despite being in the city the hotel was very quiet and restful. My only criticism was the lack of air conditioning. Although the weather was below freezing and we turned off the the heating in the room it was too warm overnight and would benefit from better temperature control.
reviews.title: Good location, glad I didnt pay full price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the booking in process was efficient and welcoming, the Hilton York is a large, rather impersonal hotel. Its main advantage is its great city centre location with the advantage of secure underground parking, the latter which we were extremely grateful for having experienced the rowdiness of some of the visitors to central York on a Saturday night.
reviews.title: Avoid the restaurant

reviews.text: The rooms are serviceable and quite comfortable albeit with relatively cheap furniture. If you have a room at the front of the hotel you will also have splendid views of Clifford’s Tower although it can be noisy at night due to passing revellers.
reviews.title: Great staff, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, there are a number of issues with this hotel, most of them centred on the restaurant. The breakfast was a buffet breakfast as is often the case in hotels such as this. The buffet system was chaotic, again not unusual but not helped in this instance by a poor design of staff entrances to the kitchen areas which meant that guests in the queue constantly had to move out of the way of staff. The quality of food was poor. Even with a buffet breakfast there is no excuse for grey, congealed scrambled egg and fried eggs sitting in pools of fat. However, the breakfast was comparatively good compared to the one dinner which we had there on our first night. The meal was bland and poorly cooked using very poor quality ingredients. A game pie consisted of thick, overcooked pastry and a filling which was of a paste like consistency. We ate out the other nights at some of the excellent restaurants in York although it is necessary to book early to get a table.
reviews.title: FIRST CLASS STAFF BUT NOT SO GOOD A STAY

reviews.text: The quality of services in the restaurant was also mixed. The dinner service was efficient and warm. Breakfast service was more perfunctionary. It’s a bit disconcerting to have a buffet tureen whipped from under your spoon by a member of staff without as much as an excuse me.
reviews.title: Very nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will not be staying at the Hilton York again. There are better, more personal hotels in York city centre and better chain hotels on the outskirts. It is a great shame that Hilton is not making the most of the hotel’s excellent location.
reviews.title: Comfort

description: The Hilton York hotel is the 4-star hotel within the city walls and located in the heart of York. Only 10 minutes walk from York Minster, the railway station and other York attractions. Do business in one of 8 meeting rooms and savour European or Tex-Mex food in the 3 bars and restaurants.
